About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

Bio

Hello, my name is Brendan Fisher and I am a Junior at the University of Florida, majoring in Computer Science and pursuing a minor in Mathematics. I have a strong interest in machine learning and AI as well as information security and emerging technologies. I have experience working as a web design intern for Wilson & Girgenti LLC. out of Tampa, Florida, as a teaching assistant for Data Structures and Algorithms at UF, and as an undergraduate research assistant in the Engaging Learning Lab at UF working on AI curriculum for a high school level summer camp in Orlando.

I am proficient in C++, C#, and React with experience using Java, MATLAB, SQL, and Python. I have experience with Agile Scrum development methodology and am currently interested in software engineering/development internships for Summer 2022.

Work Experience

Wilson & Girgenti, LLC

Web Design Intern

Managed the front end of the company’s website. Performed tasks including but not limited to, adding new projects to the website, improving the website’s SEO to increase search engine visibility, and developing additions to the website such as training videos for employees.

University of Florida

Data Structures Teaching Assistant

Led office hour sections to assist students with any questions or concerns they had about the course. Graded assessments/projects and provided meaningful feedback and advice to students to help them improve as programmers.

Projects

Florida Club Golf Website

  • Designed a web app to act as a centralized location for club members and supporters to gather information about club happenings or upcoming events.
  • Implemented role-based access control to allow club officers to seamlessly manage website content and reach out to club members or any registered users.

Covid-19 Dashboard

  • Built a MERN stack application which compared the efficiency of Breadth-First Search and Djikstra’s Algorithm when finding the shortest path between any two bus stops in Gainesville.
  • Gathered bus route and stop information from official Transloc Rest API.

Accomplishments

Benacquisto Award Recipient

I received the Benacquisto Scholarship as recognition for becoming a National Merit Finalist for outstanding performance on the PSAT my junior year of high school

Undergraduate Research Scholars Program

An extremely exclusive program comprised of only the top 336 students of the entire incoming class

Honors Program

A program consisting of the top 10% of the incoming student body
